CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 27, 1952, pg. 6, reads: "'I Am An American' Day Celebration - More than 15,000 school children and adults celebrated 'I Am An American Day' at Forbes Field last week. City officials and religious leaders addressed this giant patriotic rally. Among the entertainers who, along with Maurice Spitalney's [Spitalny] orchestra and the Marine Barracks Drum and Bugle Corps, gave their talents to make the occasion a success, were, left to right: Velma Carey, talented television feature singer; Richard Hayes, Jackie Heller, who emceed the show; Maureen Cannon and Bob Carroll. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Singer Velma Carey, Richard Hayes, Jackie Heller, Maureen Cannon, and Bob Carroll singing, with Maurice Spitalny orchestra in background, for "I am an American Day" celebration at Forbes Field, Oakland
